newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: HGC in A$36.9 mln Perth hotel deal.
newsitem.headline: HGC in A$36.9 mln Perth hotel deal.

text.p: Hotel Grand Central Ltd (HGC) said on Monday it planned to buy a hotel and retail complex in Perth, Australia in a deal worth Australia $36.9 million.
HGC said in a statement the purchase from International Village Hotels Pty Ltd would allow it to "participate in the growing tourist industry in Western Australia".
After a 10 percent downpayment, final settlement could be in one lump sum or two instalments of A$16.3 million and A$16.9 million with the second payable 90 days from the date of the agreement.
Finance for the deal, due to be completed by June 27 and subject to regulatory approval, would be raised through bank borrowings.
In a separate statement, HGC said its subsidiary Grand Central (Australia) Pte Ltd had agreed to sell a hotel in Sydney for Australian $16.6 million.
HGC said it made an excess of A$1.19 million as the book value of the property was A$15.43 million.
The amount would be used to reduce bank borrowings.
The disposal of the property was to realign the assets and resources of the company taking into consideration the present condition of the North Sydney property market, the statement added.
